alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 2:41PM CDT until September 01 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Houston County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 241 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Kinsey, Avon, Pearce, Barber, Sigma, Pleasant Plains, Enon and Farley Nuclear Plant. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
